pages.text: Endothiodon was a common and widespread, fairly large-sized, dicynodont during the late Permian. It was herbivorous and lacked the tusks of related animals, instead having its front jaw modified into a beak for shearing plant matter. There were several species which all lived in the southern half of Pangaea.
